headline: Jamaica Declares Sanctions on U.S., Citing $0
context: Jamaica's Prime Minister formally enacted sanctions on the United States today, after a difficult meeting where the President was called "$1" by the minister.
The U.S. relies heavily on Jamaican exports of $2, drawing fears of a major economic depression. Many Americans are applying for Jamaican citizenship.
"You know what they say: $3," said Desomond Brown, head of the Jamaican Immigration Office. "We expect to see many more applications in the coming months."
Jamaica has vowed that sanctions will remain until the United States ceases its $4 production and "chills out."

every little thing gonna be alright
